description.narrative: PIMS4625 Strengthening Management and Generating Multiple Environment Benefits Within and Around the Greater Kafue National Park and West Lunga National Park in Zambia

activity-description.narrative: Kafue National Park and West Lunga Game Management Areas, Zambia

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Biodiversity and carbon sinks of Greater Kafue West Lunga in Zambia are better protected from threats and effectively managed by local institutions communities and economic actors using sustainable forestry and land management practices

Sustainable Land and Forest Management established in Miombo Woodland and Dry Evergreen Forest ecosystems in PA Core areas and Community managed GMAs and conservancies enabling forest corridor connectivity between WLNP and KNP in the long term

comment.narrative:
24164 km2
PA Core areas

24164 km2 PA 41297 km2 GMAs
65461 km2
Target GMAs consisting of Mumbwa Namwala Mufunta KasonsoBusanga and LungaLuswishi in Greater Kafue NP and Lukwawa Musele Matembo and ChibwikaNtambu in West Lunga Management Area

This development target is on course so far Kafue National Park KNP 22480 sq km and West Lunga National Park WLNP1684 sq km in terms of initial efforts to put in place an effective system to remove threats such as poaching and protecting the biodiversity This has been through enhanced law enforcement fire management research to manage the carnivores infrastructure development to support law enforcement tourism and monitoring This has contributed to the increase in animal population particularly the elephants and buffalos KNP Annual Report 2014 In WLNP a similar situation has occurred where more elephant and buffalo sighting have been reported WLNP Ecological Monitoring Report 2014 Furthermore WLNP and Lukwakwa GMA have been designated as an Important Bird Area Birdlife International 2014 The project contribution has been mainly through community awareness raising activities on the need to conserve the natural resources and remove the threats to biodiversity
Regarding the Game Management Areas MuseleMateboChibwikaNtambo and Lukwakwa Kasonso Busanga Lunga Luswishi comprising a total area of 28910 square km against the target of 41297 square km have been brought under improved management This comprises 70 of the targeted area The improved management has been through strengthening the Community Based Natural Resources Management CBNRM through the village scouts and promoting sustainable livelihoods fish farming beekeeping conservation farming and agro forestry This has contributed to improved resources management and communities are in the process of establishing the conservancies in open areas
The contribution of the project was through strengthening CBNRM

65461 km2

The contribution of the project was through strengthening CBNRM

description.narrative: Increased management effectiveness and financial sustainability of Greater Kafue and West Lunga PA system
3 Reduction in funding gap of the targeted National Parks moving up one category based on REMNPAS financial viability assessment with at least one new PPP formed WLNP

comment.narrative:
0 PPP in Greater KNP and WLNP
revenues approx 600000 in KNP

At least 1 PPP in each of core PAs of Greater WLNP and KNP
at least 850000 revenues in KNP
increase by 10 per annum

This target is on trackThere has been an improvement in the revenue for the KNP from USD 600000 to USD 750000 This is due to the increased animal population elephant lion cheetah and buffalo improved park infrastructure roads air strips and lodges to the park and improved marketing KNP Annual Report 2014
The projects contribution has been through community awareness in GMAs surrounding KNP on the need to conserve wildlife

At least 1 PPP in each of core PAs of Greater WLNP and KNP
at least 850000 revenues in KNP
increase by 10 per annum

This target is on trackThere has been an improvement in the revenue for the KNP from USD 600000 to USD 750000 This is due to the increased animal population elephant lion cheetah and buffalo improved park infrastructure roads air strips and lodges to the park and improved marketing KNP Annual Report 2014
The projects contribution has been through community awareness in GMAs surrounding KNP on the need to conserve wildlife

40 WLNP
30 WLNP GMAs

Although a lot more still needs to be done this target is on course as the score of Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool METTPAZ of 59 and 30 Zambia Wildlife Report 2014 against the target of 65 and 40 respectively This has been through enhanced law enforcement fire management research to manage the carnivores infrastructure development to support law enforcement tourism and monitoring This has contributed to the increase in animal population particularly the elephants and buffalos KNP Annual Report 2014 In WLNP a similar situation has occurred where more elephant and buffalo sighting have been reported WLNP Ecological Monitoring Report 2014 Furthermore WLNP and Lukwakwa GMA have been designated as an Important Bird Area Birdlife International 2014 The project contribution has been mainly through community awareness raising activities on the need to conserve the natural resources and remove the threats to biodiversity

description.narrative: Sustainable land and forest management by Community Conservancies in GMA buffer areas through selected CBNRM practices
3 Demonstration of avoided deforestation no net loss in at least 25 VAGs establishing REDD pilots linking to national andor voluntary carbon financing

comment.narrative: 0 ha no REDD pilots in VAGs

25000 ha leveraging additional 75000 ha intact forest by protecting VAG designated forest zones
VCS and CCB standard acceptable to international brokers certifying REDD pilots and marketing for carbon financing
Potential buyers identified to purchase the REDD carbon credits from the VAG pilots
No change The activities have not taken place the have been planned for subsequent quarters

description.narrative:
2 Conservation farming practices applied in targeted GMAs
Increased yields

comment.narrative: 0 ha using conservation farming techniques

At least 3760 ha of conservation farming practiced by at least 1600 HH in 40 VAGs by end of project
Introduction of conservation farming practices leads to improved soil organic matter and field intensification across 3760 hectares leading to
40 reduction in cumulative CO2 emissions from vegetation clearance for agriculture in targeted areas resulting in 7520 ha of avoided deforestation in targeted areas
Resulting decrease in direct lifetime avoided t CO2 emissions from clearance of vegetation for agriculture 20 years in that same landscape 988128 tCO2e compared to BAU scenario

This target is on course Communities in West Lunga game management areas have been mobilized sensitized and oriented in conservation farming So far 500 against the target of 1600 households in 2014205 farming season are practicing conservation farming This presents 31 of the target The productivity of maize for those farmers who are practicing conservation farming have increased from 2 tonnes per hectare to 8 tonnes per hectare per year

description.narrative:
1a Community Conservancies established
1b VAGs legally established
1cILUA plans completed for all VAGs
1d Women members in VAGs and improved livelihoods

comment.narrative:
0 ha
0
No ILUAs in place for VAGs 0
Negligible women representation in governance structure in VAG areas

557 900 ha 5579 km2 of intact forest ecosystems established as community conservancies in targeted GMAs
At least 25 Village Action Groups VAGs in target areas formally recognized and constituted by Y2 with clear resource rights delineation of legally recognized VAG boundaries and use zones management structures and benefit sharing plans in line with national REDD criteria
Integrated Land Use Assessment plans developed for all VAGs
At least 40 female representation in all elected VAGs in project area increased per capita household income compared to 2012 baseline

This target is on course Sustainable land and forest management by Community Conservancies in GMA buffer areas through selected CBNRM practices
Sustainable land and forest management by the communities is progressing though at a low rate So far 188128 ha in Sanje Local Forest in Mumbwa and Lunda National Forest in Mwinilunga are being managed sustainably with the involvement of local communities against the target of 557900 ha This is 34 of the target The promoting sustainable livelihoods beekeeping and conservation farming tree planting and sustainable utilisation of the forest products and enhanced law enforcement North Western and Central Province Provincial Forest Reports 2014
The contribution of the project has been through community awareness on sustainable utilisation of natural resources
Regarding the targets on improved governance structures land use planning and REDD the status remains as at the project design

description.narrative: 5 Reduced rate of deforestation from late season fires in targeted GMA zones

comment.narrative:
Late season fires and poor fire management monitoring and practices in all targeted GMA zones
174671 ha of forests burned in lateseason fires annually in GMA areas in KNP
627088 ha of forests burned in lateseason fires annually in PA zones of KNP
Annual estimated CO2 emissions from fire in GMA zones of KNP 230566 tCO2e per annum
Annual estimated CO2 emissions from fire in PA parts of KNP 827756 tCO2e per annum

Land use and forest conservation plans will be developed and adopted by all VAGs supported and monitored by Kafue Central Business Unit CBU
Forest and wildlife patrolling and protection will be done by Village Scouts in all targeted GMAs
Fire control action plans will be adopted and put in use in all VAGs
As a result fire losses will be reduced by at least 30 in GMA zones annually through fire protection practices boundary and firebreak management early burning etc land use planning patrolling and education
The resulting direct lifetime avoided t CO2 emissions over 20 years from these activities compared to a BAU scenario in GMA zones 1383394 tCO2e

There has been no change as the project focus in the reporting period was on sensitization The next step would be engaging the communities in undertaking fire management through the Village Actions Groups

Land use and forest conservation plans will be developed and adopted by all VAGs supported and monitored by Kafue Central Business Unit CBU
Forest and wildlife patrolling and protection will be done by Village Scouts in all targeted GMAs
Fire control action plans will be adopted and put in use in all VAGs
As a result fire losses will be reduced by at least 30 in GMA zones annually through fire protection practices boundary and firebreak management early burning etc land use planning patrolling and education
The resulting direct lifetime avoided t CO2 emissions over 20 years from these activities compared to a BAU scenario in GMA zones 1383394 tCO2e

There has been no change as the project focus in the reporting period was on sensitization The next step would be engaging the communities in undertaking fire management through the Village Actions Groups

description.narrative: 4 Reduced rate of deforestation from fuel wood extraction in all targeted GMAs

comment.narrative:
Unsustainable firewood collection and SFM governance
Wood fuel collection in designated areas is adhoc and unsustainable
No sustainable woodlots exist in targeted areas
Knowledge of coppicing practices for fuel wood extraction among communities in targeted areas is very low

Under the project designated zones for fuel wood collection will be established optimizing SFM and testing different treatments
Working with the Copperbelt University the 25 VAGs will be trained in harvesting and coppice management and will each establish an auditable fuel wood use and CFM plan
Linked to land use planning experimental fuel wood management and collection zones will be established in 25 VAGs systems boundaries for VAGs will be defined and alternative operational modalities for fuel wood harvesting and use will be applied including coppicing
Leading to the following GEBs
Direct lifetime avoided emissions savings of 63281 tCO2e 20 years compared to fuel wood usage in a BAU scenario
There has been no change as the project focus in the reporting period was on sensitization The next step would be engaging the communities in the development of land use plans

Under the project designated zones for fuel wood collection will be established optimizing SFM and testing different treatments
Working with the Copperbelt University the 25 VAGs will be trained in harvesting and coppice management and will each establish an auditable fuel wood use and CFM plan
Linked to land use planning experimental fuel wood management and collection zones will be established in 25 VAGs systems boundaries for VAGs will be defined and alternative operational modalities for fuel wood harvesting and use will be applied including coppicing
Leading to the following GEBs
Direct lifetime avoided emissions savings of 63281 tCO2e 20 years compared to fuel wood usage in a BAU scenario
There has been no change as the project focus in the reporting period was on sensitization The next step would be engaging the communities in the development of land use plans

description.narrative: Sustainable Land and Forest Management established in Miombo Woodland and Dry Evergreen Forest ecosystems in Protected Area (PA) Core areas and Community managed Game Management Areas (GMAs) and conservancies enabling forest corridor connectivity between West Lunga National Park (WLNP) and Kfue National Park (KNP) in the long term

comment.narrative: Biodiversity and carbon sinks of Kafue/West Lunga in Zambia are better protected from threats and effectively managed by local institutions, communities, and economic actors using sustainable forestry and land management practices

1. Implement Training Strategy for IPs 2. Conduct Joint resource protection patrols in forestry and wildlife PAs 3. Finalise and implement Fire Management Strategy 4. Finalise and Implement Integrated Land Use Plans 5. Implementation of community REDD+ activities 6. Train VAG members in governance and financial management 7. Conduct Aerial Survey in KNP 8. Implement Community Forest Management activities

1. IP staff trained in GIS, gender mainstreaming, fire management, carbon assessment calculation 2 Joint resource protection patrols in forestry and wildlife PAs conducted 3. Draft Fire Management Strategy validated 4. Draft Integrated Land Use Plans validated 5. Implementation of Community REDD+ activities initiated 6. VAG members not trained in governance and financial management 7. Aerial Survey not conducted in KNP. 8. Assessment of potential for Community Forest Management activities conducted

1. 1 PPP established in West Lunga ecosystem 2. Patrol teams for KNP (Kasempa and Mumbwa AMU) using SMART for effective recording of data 3. Area burnt in Kafue National Park reduced by 5% 4. Reduced emissions of 82,500t CO2 in Kafue National Park 5. 1 Community Forest Management Manual developed 6. Increased household income 7. 40% reduction in cumulative CO2 emissions from vegetation clearance for agriculture 8. decrease in direct lifetime avoided t CO2 emissions from clearance of vegetation for agriculture 9. Potential buyers identified to purchase the REDD+ carbon credits from the VAG pilots

1. PPP was not established. Negotiations were discontinued when the private partner withdrew 2. Patrol teams for KNP (Kasempa and Mumbwa AMU) using Spatial Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) although training not financed by the Project 3. Area burnt in Kafue National Park increased by 4% but reduced between 2-14 in the GMAs 4. Emission are estimated to reduce by -9.4 in 2020 in KNP which is equivalent to 29.8 to 34.8mtons of CO2e 5. 1 Community Forest Management Manual developed 6. House hold income increased 7. 6 protected areas showed a reduction in deforestation and in emissions associated with deforestation 8. Not achieved 9. Potential buyers were identified to purchase REDD+ carbon credits from the VAG pilots

1. 1 PPP established in West Lunga ecosystem 2. Community Law Enforcement teams trained in Spatial Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) for effective recording of data 3. At least 6 Implementing Partner staff trained in short courses and 1 at Masters level 4. Management and monitoring of fire conducted 5. 388,152 ha of intact forest ecosystem established under Community Forest Management 6. Incomes from livelihood activities increased 7. Conservation farming practices applied 8. Conservation farming practiced by 1,600 farmers in 40 Village Action Groups 9. Demonstrated avoided deforestation in 25 selected VAGs 10. Communities in 25 VAGs trained in REDD+ 11. Rate of deforestation from late fires reduced by 5%

Progress as at 3rd Quarter: 1. Final review of management agreement between Government, Kalumbila Trident Foundation and local communities for or West Lunga ecosystem is ongoing 2. Spatial Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) not done 3. Implementing Partner staff not trained in short courses and Masters level 4. Data on fire occurrences and acreage burnt collected in preparation for capacity building training of IP staff in monitoring of wildfires using remote sensing and fire awareness and sensitisation of natural resource users in the project areas. Final Draft Fire Strategy reviewed 5. 334,300 ha of forest area set aside for REDD+ piloting and additional 75,000 ha expected to be leveraged as VAG designated forest zones 6. Income from increased productivity from conservation farming increased by US$840/ha/year. Small Grants disbursed for additional livelihood activities expected to increase income further 7. Conservation farming practices on additional 3,994 ha in 2018/19 agricultural season 8. Conservation farming practiced by additional 2,615 households in 2018/19 agricultural season 9. Avoided deforestation not yet demonstrated in 25 selected VAGs where 334,300 ha of intact forest area has been set aside 10. Communities in 25 VAGs not yet trained in REDD+. Community Markets for Conservation (COMACO) has been engaged to facilitate REDD+ activities 11. Rate of deforestation from late fires has not yet been measured
Progress as at 4th Quarter 1. PPCP between Government, Kalumbila Trident Foundation and local communities for West Lunga ecosystem not established. Final review of management agreement is still ongoing 2. Spatial Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) for effective recording of data not done. Contract negotiations were not concluded 3. 1 IP staff trained at Masters level 4. Consultant contracted to facilitate fire monitoring and measurement of CO2 emissions 7. Conservation farming practices on additional 4,253 hectares during the 2019/2020 season 8. Conservation farming practiced by additional 5,374 households in during the 2019/2020 season 9. Avoided deforestation not yet demonstrated in 25 selected VAGs where 334,300 ha of intact forest area has been set aside 10. Communities in 25 VAGs not yet trained in REDD+. Community Markets for Conservation 11. Consultant contracted to measure rate of deforestation
